statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Idaho St. 67, Montana 65
article.story: POCATELLO, Idaho (AP) -- Matt Stucki made two free throws with 14 seconds left and Demetrius Monroe sank one with three seconds to go as Idaho State edged Montana 67-65 Saturday night in a Big Sky Conference quarterfinal game. The Bengals (12-18) advanced in the Big Sky tournament and will play Portland State on Tuesday in Portland, Ore. With 59 seconds left, Idaho State matched its biggest lead at 63-55 with 59 seconds left. But in the next 45 seconds, Idaho State made only one free throw, while the Grizzlies' Andrew Strait hit two layups and teammate Matt Martin sank a 3-pointer to cut the Bengals' lead to 64-62 with 14 seconds left. After the two free throws by Stucki and one by Monroe, Montana's Cameron Rundles connected for a 3-pointer at the buzzer. Idaho State was led by Logan Kinghorn, who had 17 points and 10 rebounds. Three other Bengals scored in double figures; Stucki and Austin Kilpatrick, with 11 points each, and Donnie Carson, with 10. The Grizzlies (14-15) were paced by Martin, with 16 points, including five 3-pointers; Ryan Staudacher, with 14 points, and Strait, with 13. The Grizzlies led 32-26 at halftime. In the second half, the Bengals hit 77.8 percent of their field-goal attempts. Idaho State outrebounded Montana 36-24.
